lines.text: 'Sé mo laoch mo ghile mear
lines.translation: He is my hero, my swift knight.
lines.grammar: This line employs a poetic idiom, where "mo" is used to express possession or affection, similar to English phrases like "my own" or "my very". The use of "mo" instead of the more literal "am mo laoch" emphasizes the speaker's strong emotional connection.

lines.text: 'Sé mo Shéasar, gile mear

lines.text: Suan gan séan ní bhfuair mé féin

lines.grammar: The use of "féin" (myself) emphasizes the speaker's personal experience, highlighting the first-person singular pronoun "mé". This idiomatic expression indicates that the speaker is speaking from their own perspective.
